Changing the Visual Merge Window

On the Visual Merge window, you can display or hide the toolbar or status bar, or move the toolbar. You can also change the colors that display in the window.

To display or hide the toolbar or status bar:

  1. In the Visual Merge window, select Search > Options from the menu bar. The Options dialog opens.

  2. Click the Display tab.

  3. Select the Line numbers check box to show these numbers in the Visual Merge window.

  4. Select or hide the toolbar by checking or clearing the Display toolbar check box.

  5. Select or hide the status bar by checking or clearing the Display status bar check box.

  6. Click OK.

To move the toolbar:

In the Visual Merge window, drag the toolbar to any location on or off the window. If that location is an edge of the Visual Merge window, the toolbar docks there. Otherwise, it floats.

 

To change the colors that display in Visual Merge:

  1. In the Visual Merge window, select Search > Options from the menu. The Options dialog opens.

  2. Click the Color tab.

  3. Select a type of text from the Set color for box, which lists Matching Text, Replaced Text, Inserted Text, and Deleted Text. Each of these items is shown in the color currently used for that type of text.

  4. Click Select color. The Color dialog opens.

  5. Select a color from the Basic colors or Custom colors list.

    6. If no Custom colors have been created:

    1. Click Define custom colors. The Color dialog expands to display all available colors.

    2. Select a color from the color refiner box of available colors. Variations in brightness for the selected color appear in the luminosity bar to the right.

    3. Move the slider in the luminosity bar to change the color shown in the Color/Solid box. Information about the selected color appears in the text boxes beneath the color refiner box.

    4. Click Add to custom colors. You will now be able to select this color from the Custom colors list.

  6. When you have selected a color, click OK to return to the Set color for list box. The sample box shows the text in the new color.

  7. Repeat steps 3 to 5 for any other colors you want to change.

  8. Click OK when all of the colors have been selected.

To return to the default colors in Visual Diff:

  1. Select Search > Options from the menu bar. The Options dialog opens.

  2. Click the Color tab.

  3. Click Default Colors.
